Description of incident: Three spreadsheets containing              5,200 Social Security numbers and other personal details about customers              were inadvertently leaked over an online file-sharing network by a              former employee. Tiversa, a company that monitors P2P networks, found              Excel spreadsheets from the desktop of a financial analyst at ABN              Amro Mortgage Group running LimeWire. Although Tiversa found over              10,000 files, deduplication revealed only 5,208 unique Social Security              numbers, along with names and what type of mortgage each customer              had.
